reviews.productTitle: Lutron Toggler LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs, 150 Watt, Single-Pole or 3-Way, TGCL-153PH-IV, Ivory
reviews.text: I have a few of these so I feel like a bit of an expert. They do work well but the one seems a bit finicky. What I mean is the light doesn’t stay the same dimness. 99.9% of the time has been good. I love having dimmers all over the house. Being able to adjust the brightness is awesome.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2025
reviews.title: Pretty good dimmer

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Toggler LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs, 150 Watt, Single-Pole or 3-Way, TGCL-153PH-IV, Ivory
reviews.text: I installed 4 of these a few years ago, and now only one works. I liked them while they lasted, easy to use, for with the look of the house. Unfortunately three of them don’t work well. They flicker, they go only part of the way up or part of the way down in brightness when you move the slider. Sometimes they start low and slowly get brighter despite not touching the switch at all. Very disappointing.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2024
reviews.title: 3 of 4 don’t work.

reviews.text: I bought this specifically, so my set of ceiling can LED lights would not “buzz“ while on. However, the lights still buzz, quite annoyingly, regardless of whether I adjust it to a dimmed setting or have it on full brightness. (By the way, my LED lights are designed to be “dimmable.”) Disappointing.

reviews.title: LED lights STILL BUZZ despite this switch :-(

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Toggler LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs, 150 Watt, Single-Pole or 3-Way, TGCL-153PH-IV, Ivory
reviews.text: I've installed many dimmer switches previously and never had any issues (different brands). These were VERY frustrating to install. I normally use the screw connections (more secure). However, these are impossible to do well and very frustrating. The terminals are inset into the body with too much gap between the wire and the screw. You tighten the screw, and the wire just pops out from under the screw. There shouldn't be enough clearance to do that. If you try to make a loop in the wire to keep it in, there isn't enough room to have much of a loop. Next, I tried using the push-in connection. But the hole for that connection was too small for my 12-gauge wire. What should have been a 10-minute install took an hour of frustrating time... times 3 (I bought 3 switches). All 3 switches were the same. They worked fine once installed. But what a pain to get the wires connected!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022
reviews.title: Very hard to install

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Toggler LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs, 150 Watt, Single-Pole or 3-Way, TGCL-153PH-IV, Ivory
reviews.text: Bought for LED bulbs in bathrooms and for other LED bulbs in hallway, dining room and ceiling fans. No flickering, etc like cheap dimmers might cause. Very pleased.

reviews.title: Excellent quality.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Toggler LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs, 150 Watt, Single-Pole or 3-Way, TGCL-153PH-IV, Ivory
reviews.text: They would not dim enough for my customer and they flicker when you dim them. I bought thirty of them for a customer and she said take them out. I have them installed for Nicor dimmable recess led bulbs. I bought thirty of some other brand prior, but they did not dim as good as the Lutron. So I got sixty dimmers that I can't use. I think this dimmer would be good on another brand bulb. I can not find a toggle dimmer that works with these bulbs. I'm out over $1,300.00.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2021
reviews.title: They would not dim low enough

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Toggler LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs, 150 Watt, Single-Pole or 3-Way, TGCL-153PH-IV, Ivory
reviews.text: Pros: The 'slider' does not move to full on like some others when the light is turned off. Works with 3 way switches. CONS: Finding -if- your LED bulbs are "compatible" with this is a chore. Even if it "works" it is far from perfect. Example: I tried it with equivalent 40 watt bulbs. The 'dimming' is very limited before they start flickering off, so they go from 480 lumen to 380? lumen. Not a lot of sense in using it if it has such a limited range. Something else I noticed, it doesn't 'appear' that the LED lights are quite as bright (when at full brightness) as when the standard ON/OFF switch was used, although I have no way of verifying such. My opinion - buy at you own risk if you intend to use this with LED lighting.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
reviews.title: LED light dimmer -Iffy at best

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Toggler LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs, 150 Watt, Single-Pole or 3-Way, TGCL-153PH-IV, Ivory
reviews.text: These are bulky, so you might have trouble fitting these in a two gang, and probably not be able to fit in a three gang. Otherwise these were great. I’m leaving a review today because I installed 9 of these about three years ago. One failed today - turned on the switch, heard a sizzling sound and it no longer worked. Shorted out. This switch controlled an all LED light circuit in 10 canisters (led retrofit kits). Too bad the warranty is only one year. these are some expensive light switches!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020
reviews.title: 1/9 switches failed after 3 years of use

reviews.text: Works as advertised. I hear a buzzing/humming noise from the lights, however my parents do not. It works tho. The lights are LED dimmable and it fits perfectly under a normal switch cover. I have two switches for the one light and as long as you Kill the power to the breaker and ReWire it exactly as it came out, you should have no problem installing it. Or call an electrician.

reviews.title: First one died immediately. Second one has been no problem.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Toggler LED+ Dimmer Switch for Dimmable LED, Halogen and Incandescent Bulbs, 150 Watt, Single-Pole or 3-Way, TGCL-153PH-IV, Ivory
reviews.text: This dimmer works much better than the one it replaced. I gave this 4 stars because it does not turn on the 8 -100W equivalent Feit LED lights when the dimmer is set at about 80% or lower. The lights are within the load capacity. This dimmer was rated "The best of the best" in a review, but if holding the dimming setting and switching on from that setting is important to you, this one may not be the best choice. So long as you are ok with turning it almost all the way up to full bright to turn it on, then dimming to the desired setting, this dimmer will work well.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2019
reviews.title: Better dimming range than others, no flicker or buzz; does not come on set below ~80%
